text.__SUMMARY__: Aspergillus germanicus is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus which has been isolated from indoor air in Germany. It is from the Usti section.
text.Growth and morphology: A. germanicus has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below.
text.Further reading: "Aspergillus germanicus Varga, Frisvad & Samson sp. nov. A–C. Colonies... - Figure 6 of 9". ResearchGate.
